description.narrative: Project supports strategic reforms ensuring sustainable institutional development of the Parliament of Georgia. A smaller component targets institutional strengthening of the legislature of the Ajara Autonomous Republic - Supreme Council of Ajara (SCA).
seat of a first-order administrative division

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative:
Impact Ind. 1: Democratic governance rate at national level (Freedom House, Nations in Transit) Impact Ind. 2: Georgia Voice and Accountability Index (World Bank, WGI)

Output Indicator 1.1.1(a): Availability of guidelines on the Parliament’s role in legislative process Output Indicator 1.1.1(b): Number of MPs and staff (both men and women) trained on policy-planning standards

Output Indicator 1.1.3(a): Availability of strategic development vision of the Parliamentary Research Centre Output Indicator 1.1.3(b): Availability of knowledgeable and skilled staff (both men and women) to provide high-quality research and analytical services to MPs

Output Indicator 1.2.2: Availability of best international practices of collaboration between the Parliament and independent state institutions
Output Indicator 1.2.3: Availability of regulatory procedures allowing for increased role of the Parliament in emergency situations
Output Indicator 1.3.1(a): Availability of 2021-2022 Action Plan

- Finalization of the inception phase - Recruitment of the Project Staff - Signing the Responsible Party Agreements

- Inception phase has been successfully finalized and key activities for 2020 identified. - Project recrutied a new staff - Institutional Development Specialist; Recruitment of the Project Officer for Ajara component is being finalized. Person to be recrutied by mid-January 2020. - Responsible Party Agreements have been signed with both the WFD and IDFI. Both organizations started implementing their respective activities.

- Technical expertise in law-making and scrutiny provided to at least one committee - Concept notes and operating guidelines for the Parliamentary Research Centre developed - Guidelines in legal research and drafting developed; respective trainings delivered - International workshop on legislative research services organized - At least 2 thematic inquiries/post-legislative scrutiny (PLS) processes facilitated - Development of the Open Parliament Action Plan for 2020-2021 facilitated - Informational materials prepared on citizen engagement tools available at the Parliament - Citizens Guide to Legislative Engagement developed - MP induction program upgraded and a new MP Guidebook developed - Educational module – Parliament for Children - developed - Parliament’s Business Continuity Management (BCM) system designed - Institutional needs assessment of the Supreme Council of Ajara conducted and recommendations developed - Induction program for newly elected members of the Supreme Council designed and the member guidebook developed - Introduction of openness principles at the Supreme Council facilitated through formation of the Open Governance Council, its consultative group and development of the openness action plan.

- Technical expertise was provided to the Environmental Protection Committee on draft legislation on water resource management and environmental assessment code. Expert recommendations were reflected in the committee reports. - Concept notes and operating guidelines were prepared for the Parliamentary Reserch Centre to help in setting international standards and best practices in the work of the Cenre - Guidelines in legal research and drafting were developed and respective trainings and on the-job consultancies were provided to the Research Centre staff - International workshop on legislative research services were postponed due to the Covid-19 related challenges. The workshop is postponed to 2021 and its organization in remote regime is considered. - Three thematic inquiries/post-legislative scrutiny (PLS) processes were facilitated at three different Committees - Environment, Education and Sports and Youth. Reports of the inquiries have been published and presented to the Government - Development of the Open Parliament Action Plan for 2020-2021 has been postponed due to the Covid-19 related challenges that were followed by pre-electoral period when the Members of the Parliaments Open Governance Council were engaged in pre-electoral campaigning. The process has moved to 2021. - Informational materials on citizen engagement tools available at the Parliament were prepared and will be available at the Citizen Reception Hall (once it opens), at municipalities and online - Citizens Guide to Legislative Engagement has been developed, pending approval by the Parliament - MP induction program has been upgraded; the sessions will be held in early February 2021; a new MP Guidebook has been also developed and distributed to the newly-elected MPs during the first plenary session in December 2020. - Educational module – Parliament for Children - has been developed. It consists of secondary schools students handbook for 5-6th graders and 7th graders and respective methodological manuals for teachers. The textbooks have been approved by the Ministry of Education to be in line with the civic education standards applied in Georgia. Its pilot launch in 50 public schools in Georgia is planned for 2021. - Parliament’s Business Continuity Management (BCM) policy document and action plans for each administrative have been developed. The system will become operaiton from 2021. - Institutional needs assessment of the Supreme Council of Ajara has been conducted with active participation from the Council members and staff. Recommendations have been developed which shall lay basis to the Councils institutional development strategy and action plan planned for 2021. - Induction program for newly elected members of the Supreme Council has been designed and its delivery is expected in late February 2021. The guidebook for the members of the Council has been developed and distributed during the first session of the Council in December 2020. - Institutionalization of openness principles at the Supreme Council of Ajara has been successful: the Council adopted amendments to its Rules of Procedure and formed an open governance council to implement and monitor openness reforms locally. The project also facilitated the creation of a consultative group comprised of local civil society organizations. The Council developed and adopted its first ever openness action plan for 2020-2021 with active CSO engagement.

Outcome Ind. 1.1: 50% (target for 2022) Outcome Ind. 1.2: 50% (target for 2022) Outcome Ind. 1.3: 70% (target for 2022) Outcome Ind. 2.1: Strategy/AP in place (target for 2022) Outcome Ind. 2.2: 50% (target for 2022)

Outcome Ind. 1.1: 50% Outcome Ind. 1.2: 17% Outcome Ind. 1.3: 16% (target for 2022) Outcome Ind. 2.1: SCA Institutional Development Strategy (including AP), Communications Strategy and Openness Plan developed and adopted Outcome Ind. 2.2: 11% (target for 2022)
Output Indicator 1.1.1(a): Guide on Legislative Process was developed and delegated to the Parliaments Training Center. Projects overall progress on this output indicator - 95%. Output Indicator 1.1.1(b): N/A for 2021. Projects overall progress on this output indicator - 26%.
Output Indicator 1.1.2(a): Two committees (Environmental Protection and Natural Resources, Agrarian Issues) were equipped with knowledge about major policy issues in their fields of competence and consulted during the scrutiny of draft legislation. Projects overall progress on this output indicator - 50% Output Indicator 1.1.2(b): N/A for 2021. Projects overall progress on this output indicator - 0%
Output Indicator 1.1.3(a): Five concept papers as well as guidelines for the Centre’s operation were developed to form basis for the Centre’s strategy. Projects overall progress on this output indicator - 40% Output Indicator 1.1.3(b): Full composition of the Research Centre Staff (11 women and 4 men) were trained and consulted about the best international practices in legislative research services, including legislative research and writing. Projects overall progress on this output indicator - 100%
Output Indicator 1.2.1(a): Seven Thematic Inquires/Post Legislative Scrutiny processes for total 5 committees finalized - Projects overall progress on this output indicator - 94% Output Indicator 1.2.1(b): 59 CSOs both from Tbilisi and regions were trained on thematic inquiries and PLS processes. Projects overall progress on this output indicator - 100%
Output Indicator 1.2.2: Initial methodology screening conducted, international and local experts were hired. Initial Meetings conducted. Action Plan Designed. Projects overall progress on this output indicator - 10%
Output Indicator 1.2.3: International Experts Contracted. Webinar on Improving the role of Parliaments in Emergencies conducted, with 2 sessions (1. Oversight in emergencies 2. E-parliamentary tools during emergencies and beyond). Projects overall progress on this output indicator - 30%
Output Indicator 1.3.1(a): Open Parliament Action Plan developed and adopted. Projects overall progress on this output indicator - 100% Output Indicator 1.3.1(b): Implementation of the 3 commitments from the plan launched. Projects overall progress on this output indicator - 30%
Output Indicator 1.3.2(a): Citizen Guide is developed and will be made available at the Citizen Reception Hall in the Parliament, local municipalities and the Parliaments website. Projects overall progress on this output indicator - 100% Output Indicator 1.3.2(b): A comprehensive study/survey on the effectiveness of citizen engagement mechanisms available at the Parliament conducted. The final report is in the process of approval. Projects overall progress on this output indicator - 100% Output Indicator 1.3.2(c): A training on reporting mechanisms for the OGP council secretariat is being planned - Projects overall progress on this output indicator - 100%
Output Indicator 1.3.3: N/A for 2021. The activities will be launched in 2022. Projects overall progress on this output indicator - 0%.
Output Indicator 1.3.4: Civic Education Module was elaborated and piloted in public schools, followed by the public awareness event – My Parliamentary Adventure. Projects overall progress on this output indicator - 100%.
Output Indicator 1.4.1(a): 180 staff members from committees and departments were trained on different topics (including those covered in 1.1.1(b), 1.1.2(a) and 1.1.3(b) above); 25 assistants to the newly-elected MPs were trained on parliamentary procedures and services. Projects overall progress on this output indicator - 100%. Output Indicator 1.4.1(b): A mobile app (PTC Mobile) was developed based on the Parliament’s e-learning platform. Projects overall progress on this output indicator - 100%. Output Indicator 1.4.1(c): N/A for 2021. Projects overall progress on this output indicator - 100%.
Output Indicator 1.4.2: One international and 3 local experts for elaboration of Strategic Development Plan of the Parliament (2022-2024) were recruited. Needs assessment methodology is being elaborated. Projects overall progress on this output indicator - 15%
Output Indicator 1.4.3: Business Continuity Management Policy Document of the Parliament as well as individual departmental plans were elaborated and adopted. Projects overall progress on this output indicator - 100%
Output Indicator 1.4.4: Parliamentary Diplomacy Framework document elaborated and presented to the speaker of the parliament. A workshop for the core structural units, introducing the new framework, is being planned. Projects overall progress on this output indicator - 90%
Output Indicator 2.1.1(a): N/A for 2021. Projects overall progress on this output indicator - 100% Output Indicator 2.1.1(b): SCAs Institutional Development Strategy and Communications Strategy, alongside the Action Plans elaborated and adopted by the Council. Projects overall progress on this output indicator - 100%
Output Indicator 2.1.2: Two commitments from the SCA Institutional Development Strategy have been implemented Projects overall progress on this output indicator - 67%
Output Indicator 2.2.1(a): N/A for 2021. Projects overall progress on this output indicator - 100% Output Indicator 2.2.1(b): N/A for 2021. Projects overall progress on this output indicator - 100%
Output Indicator 2.2.2: Eight CSOs have become part of the SCA OGP Consultative Group and two awareness raising meetings were held for them to ensure effective work in the Council.
